column4: Im having problems with my DNS server inn 11.04. when I try to connect to the internet i get this error message 105:"Unable to resolve the server's DNS address." ive checked and there is no proxie or firewall and the internet works on other computers here
the DNS server is listed as an IP address and NOT a hostname right?
im not sure what you mean, in the resolv.conf it states "# Generated by NetworkManager
resolv.conf is depricated, dont use that
ok open up a console window and type "ifconfig"
I dont understand...
open up the console...?
yep gimme a sec...
now what?
ok ive got ifconfig open
u know where ur connection manager icon is in the systray? right click it and chose "Connection information'
yep got connection info open
near the bottom youll see "Primary DNS".. what does it say?
what machine are you on currently? is it windows?
ok, but its aphysically different machine from the one with the DNS problem ya?
this machine is the one with the DNS problem, the one im on now, and checking the ifconfig etc at the same time
and this one is the one with 11.04
i dont understand... ur connected to the internet and using DNS to be on IRC... there are multiple network cards?
no, im on my netbook, using the wifi on a machine with 11.04 which can connect to this IRC, but 99% of the time it times out when loading webpages because of a "DNS error"
hrmmmmm any othe rmachines on your network that work properly?
yeah there are like 4 other computers here running windows which are fine =(
ok go to one of those and open up cmd.exe then type "ipconfig /all" see what the DNS is for those working machines
